text:
The trip to Selong Selo was amazing. Its hard to forget such a superb view outside first thing in the morning. Everything was prepared and at hand with the help of the friendly staff. I still remember a driver by the name of Mahmud. Really helpful,funny & down to earth guy. Whenever we needed him he would be there straight away and had our interest at all times. text:
This was my first trip to Lombok.  Selong has just under 30 private hideaways to rent, I was in 2E, prime location as just next door to the restaurant and gym.  It was hard to not fall in love with its knock out views, nothing but endless views of the ocean.  Being a hopeless sun worshipper, I loved the south facing sun drenched minimalist villa, both bedrooms were small but immaculate, my fav space was being stretched out by the plunge pool, as it was a bit far to hit Belanek beach (currently 15 minutes by car, but a more direct road is being built).  

This is not a holiday for those that need to have lots of shops etc as you are off the grid, far flung in the South (most hotels ie Oberoi are two hours to the North) yet only 30 min from the airport.  Selong is pretty idyllic, perfect for a few reclusive laid back days, the ( mostly local ) staff were the most welcoming people, as the wifi was not strong (I could not even download a magazine), the best thing to do is just chill with a good book & some wine, and just watch the unfolding panorama.  (the front desk staff can organize excursions but I had such a short stay it seemed sensible to stay put). 

Was a bit apprehensive about service after reading previous TA reviews so I appreciated the phone in the room that allows you to whatsapp your butler or the front desk, on top of that, Stuart and Grace were running the show, super helpful and receptive to feedback.  

In terms of insects that were mentioned in previous reviews, I did have one fly that annoying managed to slip in & hang out in the living room with me, other than that had one lone mosquito bite at the restaurant.  

This place is still in pre open phase so there is construction work all over, but some things I wrote down for Grace and Stuart as hiccups turned out to be a non issue.  Ie the switch to the bedroom ceiling lights are the “gradual” type that needs to be adjusted (I just assumed they were broken).  

Rating the overall experience a four because of the food at Aura which is limited in option and except for the Indonesian chicken, not very tasty.  Other than that, I look forward to coming back after the construction is completed.
title: Lombok hideaway

text:
Our visit was a double birthday celebratory trip and it was our first trip to Lombok. We were extremely impressed with out 5 day stay. The resort is situated off the beaten track with beautifully appointed villas and it's own infinity pool overlooking the beautuful vistas of the ocean and hills. The tranquility of this high end resort will send your stress away as soon as you set foot on the property. We were fully rejuvenated and recharged by the end of our staycation.

The staff are extremely attentive and greet you with their beautuful smiles. On my birthday, the General Manager surprised me with a cake, a bottle of bubbly and beers for the occasion which was a very kind gesture. The food and cocktail were delicious. We brought a package deal with includes daily breakfasts, 2 x 2 course meals per person, daily sundowner cocktails and 2 x 60 minute massages and return airport transfers. It was definitely great value for money. The on-site gym facility has recently opened and is equipped with a wide range of equipment. My husband and I plan to return to Selong Selo in late February. See you soon.

text: We were very nervous about this resort before we arrived as not all of its all recent reviews on trip advisor had been positive, but we thought this resort (and it’s location) was magnificent! The resort reception, restaurant and pool area are breathtakingly beautiful, as are the gardens and views. The architecture is stylish and minimal and the buildings are well built, and perfectly maintained. We could not fault our stylish enormous luxurious three bedroom villa. The villa pool (and the main pool) were pristine (I know, because I bought a pool water test kit with me and tested them just in case!) and we had no problems at all with insects, even though we were in the middle of picturesque rural untouched farming lands. If you are looking for crowds, bus loads of tourists, traffic jams, noisy nightlife, polluted beaches, dirty seawater full of plastic, being harassed by street vendors and an array of fine dining, bars and shopping, then go to Bali, this resort is not for you. If you want to be off the grid and are looking for beautiful untouched countryside, huge trees, stunning tobacco fields, water buffalos, absolutely no traffic, few tourists, clean white sand beaches and water, isolation and privacy, while still being able to enjoy tasteful brand new 5 star luxurious modern villas (not to mention a really charming beach front restaurant on the best beach in Lombok just a short complimentary shuttle bus trip away), then I would urge you to try Selong Selo. There is construction ongoing on site (which we were informed about in advance) and unfortunately for those visiting in the next couple of months, there is currently a villa being built fairly close to the reception area ...but not all villas are affected by the construction as it’s a very large property and the general management do absolutely compensate, I feel, by offering 6 star service, perks and amenities at these prices. All of the staff were efficient, friendly and made every effort to please and go that one step further....and even though some of the restaurant staff are still being trained, they get full marks for trying so hard and being so open to and appreciative of feedback, and keen to have another go at making everything perfect...so we had no complaints at all and felt like we were part of the family team ...(Personally, I would prefer to support a small new boutique resort that makes an effort to be sustainable and employ and train the locals, then stay at a big faceless branded resort that makes no effort to care for the environment and imports its labour). There is a brand new gym and an experienced new European chef just on board. In our experience it’s rare to find service and luxury like this in such an untouched part of the world and we will definitely be returning!
title: Stunning! We will be returning!

text:
My family of 5 stayed in this resort in Feb 2019 and it was just an amazing experience. The resort is built on a hill top and the views are just gorgeous. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa booked though Luxury Escapes and the whole experience was just wonderful. 

We were met at the airport and about 40 mnts later we drove up to this stunning place. The views from the reception area and every corner of the resort were simply amazing. Check-in was seamless, we were escorted to our villa and given a complete brief of everything available. The mobile phone with a direct whatsapp link to your private butler is a great touch and we did everything from order all our meals, to booked massages and transport to the beach and into town from that 1 device. 

The villa quality is top notch and you can see that no expense was spared in the build. From the design, down to the actual stone used it is apparent that alot of time and effort went into every aspect.The rooms were spacious, bathrooms luxurious and each room had a huge balcony to enjoy the outdoors, which was also meticulously designed. The huge windows that open up completely bringing the outside indoors made us enjoy the beautiful weather daily. The whole family had a blast in the villa's  infinity pool and the most amazing things of all was the service received from the staff. 

The staff were highly qualified and nothing we asked was ever a problem. Everyone goes out of their way to make the customers feel comfortable and it was an absolute pleasure being there because they made us feel so welcome. Even the resort manager Stuart took time to talk to us and find out what he could do to make us more comfortable. 

Our overall experience was amazing and the only reason I did not give the resort 5 stars is because of 2 things that marred our experience. First was the internet. I get that we were quite a distance away from everything, however for the quality of hotel i expected the internet connection to be much better than it was. Especially since the T.V was dependant on the internet, and with 2 teenage kids with me, at times the internet cutting off for long periods of time was very annoying. 

The second were the bugs. Now I do understand that it is totally normal to have creepy crawlies visiting when you are in a forest area but the amount of bugs that were coming into the villa was horrible. I'm not talking about 1 fly or a mosquito, but some seriously scary looking things. This normally happened in the evening after the turn down service because they used to come in and spray the rooms and that's when they all come out. One night we had to call reception to send someone to remove the fallen bugs and we counted a total of 11 spiders, scorpions, worms, beetle looking things and I don't even know what some of them were. The bug expert tried to reassure us and said that they were not dangerous, but being city folk it was a bit daunting seeing that everyday. The fact that the villa was so clean also didn't help because the minute a bug is around, you can't miss it. 

We did share our feedback and we could see that every effort was made to make us more comfortable. If you want a relaxing high end holiday and don't mind a little bit of nature in your space then Lombok, specifically Selong Selo is the place. Thank-you all for making our holiday truly memorable. 

Now from what they told us they are
title: Absolute Heaven

text:
We recently stayed at Selong Selo for 4 days as a group of 4 adults looking for a relaxing and lovely visit in Lombok. After much searching and reading of reviews, we decided to stay at Selong Selo as the reviews and the hotel rating would indicate that it was a 5-star hotel property with all the amenities and service needed to make for an enjoyable and relaxing stay.

Unfortunately, the stay was anything but that. 

The biggest positive is that the “resort” has some of the most amazing views, both from the main reception areas and from the villas. 

However, the biggest let down was the level of service - which was definitely lacking of being 5-star. I have travelled extensively and stayed at many hotel properties around the world and Indonesia and Selong Selo definitely doesn’t hit the mark. 

Here were a few tangible issues:
- Property is a construction site: there are roughly 14 villas at the resort and they are building 80 more, so there is constant moving of trucks and workers and loud noise through the day, to the point where access to our villa was blocked for an entire day by a cement pourer and we needed to be transported by 2-wheelers
- Bugs, Lizards, Spiders and even a scorpion: Everyday and night that we returned to our villa we encountered a large spider (2x), several lizards, several small spiders, large grasshoppers in the bedrooms and the biggest highlight, a scorpion in the living room?!?!? Some of the reviews state that the villas are sealed off from this, but that is simply not true as there are very large gaps between the doors that allow for the creepy crawlers to enter. This was so bad that for the 4 nights I stayed at Selong Selo, I was not able to sleep peacefully for a single night: quite the relaxing time I was hoping for...
- Far from everything: Selong Selo is about 1.5hrs from the main area (Kuta) and even the Selong Belanak beach is 30 mins away, therefore be prepared to make transportation arrangements to get to and from the hotel. Unfortunately the resort does not provide for transportation and if it does, it will cost you a lot - more than a meal for 4 at the Aura restaurant (750k)
- Service level was lacking: For several items the service level was not up to standard of a 5 star hotel, although management is keen to charge for everything on a 5 star basis and remind you of the additional charge on virtually everything (including breakfast, transportation, etc). On one occasion we arranged transportation through SS to take us to the Kuta beach, after getting tired of having food from a not so extensive menu at the resort. Post getting dropped off in a decent car, our pick up vehicle was a broken down old taxi that reeked of old cigarettes, a temporary wheel and no full beam headlights!! On the long and hilly ride back to the resort the car stopped and rolled back down the hill in the middle of night in complete the wilderness, which one needs to go through to get to the resort. The resort arranged for the car and we paid 4x a Blue Bird taxi (proper car and accredited service).

All in all, it was quite disappointing and not a hotel stay with a certain level of service standard. Selong Selo is a “resort and residence” which is essentially owner owned residences that are then operated by renting them out as investment purposes and not a hotel which is trying to ensure a certain service and catering to the guests. Hotel guests are a second priority and the first are the residence owners and construction of villas to be sold. Selong Selo is also one of, if not the most expensive accommodation in Lombok, so definitely not a discounted price. 

I will caveat that the staff dealt all the zoo animals in our villa quite relatively promptly and the local staff were very nice and understanding, but there should never have been such incidents or service for a property that claims to be 5-star. 

Selong Selo might be a good investment to buy a villa in, but not to stay. 

Prior to our stay in Lombok, we stayed for 8 days in Bali and I have lived in Jakarta for 10 years and travelled to several hotels, so this was just and representative review and not been this disappointed and not encountered that bugs, spiders or even seen a scorpion in my time here.
title: Disappointing...

owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write an extensive review.

We are happy you enjoyed the breathtaking views and our brand new, spacious contemporary private pool villas.

Selong Selo is currently in a soft opening phase and is the biggest development in Lombok. We do inform guests when booking with us that we have parts of the 17-hectare property which have works going on as we build more villas in the coming year. We do have construction in some parts of the resort but we always try to put our guests in a quieter area. As we are still in the soft opening phase, the prices of our luxury private pool villas have been heavily reduced in price up to a 40-60% discount for this reason.

Living in the jungle has its positives and as Lombok is such an untouched island we pride our resort in embracing the environment surrounding us instead of destroying it, so with the construction of our villas we work with the environment and vegetation. The beautiful plants and trees surrounding our villas do have wildlife including insects. Our team does regular environmentally friendly fumigation of each villa, but unfortunately, we can’t stop all the insects from getting inside the villa but I am happy my staff dealt with it promptly.

Our resort is situated on a beautiful hill overlooking Selong Belanak beach and the ride only takes only 15 minutes with our complimentary shuttle which we provide on a daily basis to our guests. Kuta is 45 minutes away from the resort should guests wish to enjoy the small community of restaurants and bars.

We do have a fleet of vehicles with licensed drivers and fully insured vehicles. On your request we organized a local taxi to take you on your return trip to Kuta but unfortunately as they are not part of our team so we have no control over the vehicle standard or maintenance, although they are blue bird taxis they are managed by the individual driver who owns the vehicle. We will not use their services again.

The prices for private trips and transportation in our resort are at a 5 star standard for what we are offering in Lombok.

We do apologize that you were inconvenienced  for the issue with works being conducted near your villa  as it was a day with more project work than usual and the fact that you had to join our staff and use the scooter to get to the reception but we do hope that you enjoyed our complimentary private transfer to the airport.

Selong Selo Resort and Residences is a resort that does have individual owners of the villas similar to other villa properties around the globe but our focus is on the guest and providing an experience where you can relax and unwind and escape the usual overpopulated tourist destinations. As a part of our commitment to the community our entire staff are from the local villages which we are training to deliver at the highest level of 5 star standard and service as our guests are our number one priority so it’s disappointing you felt service was lacking but it gives us something to work on from your experience so we appreciate your feedback as we continue to improve everyday. Our private butler service had received nothing but praise in the previous reviews.

We are sorry to hear that your stay with us wasn’t what you were expecting and we are hopeful to greet you again and give you the best Selong Selo experience. 

Kind regards,

Stuart
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Selong Selo is a jaw-droppingly beautiful series of villas which is surely notable but the exceptional service is what will make me return.  I read through Selong Selo reviews and noted that members ocassionally mentioned service glitches or delays in older months and years.  We did not find that the case with our stay; in fact, quite the opposite.  The staff was on point at every moment throughout our stay, thinking of things we might need or consider before we had considered them ourselves. They provide guests with a personal and local cellphone for communication purposes between the lounge and the villa using Whatsapp Technology.  We were in a remote, romantic, and surreal location but then with the drop of a button could order room service to our villa or line up a massage for that afternoon.  Exceptional is the word.  Selong Selo is remote but there is an idyllic beach down the road and a few popular towns, including Kuta, nearby.  Throughout our honeymoon, we alternated between "staycations" at the resort (hopping between our villa's pool and the restaurant's pool, taking couples' massages, ordering a variety of cocktails and appetizers) and adventuring around the southern coast of Lombok (visiting cliffs for sunset, exploring restaurants in Kuta, motobiking to waterfalls, snorkeling islands and beaches).  It couldn't have been a more idyllic honeymoon and Selong Selo is to thank for this.  We will be back.
title: honeymooning in paradise

text:
I have been to Lombok a few times and stayed nearby but this was my first time staying at Selong Selo and I could comfortably say it is the best place to stay on the south coast. From the moment you arrive the attention to detail from the staff is excellent, who can help you with anything from the current surf forecast to what their favourite meal on the menu is.  I have broken down below some comments from each part of the trip

The Accommodation
It would be difficult to fault any of the different villas that are currently available, given they all have breathtaking views from just about every room possible that cascade down the mountains and out into the ocean.  The rooms are sparkling clean and the attention to detail on all the bathroom and kitchen finishes are excellent. Not to mention the cold Bintangs that are in your fridge at the end of a long day surfing!

To do
The villas are 5 mins away from a beautiful secluded beach that are protected from the large swells that hit the island from time to time.  This makes them perfect for either learning to surf or just going for a swim with the white sand and blue water has to be seen to be believed. As a surfer the close proximity to Mawi was a great plus as I surfed there each day both early morning and late at night with just my mates in the water.... It doesn't get much better than that!

Aura the restaurant
A cool vibe and good ambiance (not to mention that view again) but most importantly cold beer and sensational food. Good portion size along with fresh ingredients leaving you more than satisfied.

There are some comments on this page about ongoing construction which no doubt will be something that once finished will be a positive, but in no way does it affect your stay in the villas, or your time at the restaurant. Do yourself a favour and check this place out!
title: Best place to stay on the south coast

text:
Apologies for directness in the review, but it's best that we get straight to the point.

The Pro's
- Views are amazing!
- Excellent F&B staff who are very attentive and willing to be helpful.  Not quite trained to a 5 star service standard (yet), but their genuine kindness and eagerness to satisfy the customers helps dismiss the flaws.
- Sali (Ops Manager) is awesome and makes things happen.
- Butler services and WhatsApps system works like a charm.
- Spa treatment is out of this world.

The Con's
- It's still a construction site with drilling, hammering, digging, sawing, pile driving from 7am to sundown.  Obscene amounts of construction dust getting into the villas, pool deck chairs, sofa's, kitchens, etc.
- The noise from the construction ruins the purpose of being there and does not make it relaxing.
- The Spa is still unfinished and the blinds can't be pulled up because of the construction occurring.
- The driveways down to the villa's are unfinished so you're likely to trip over on the uneven ground like we did, especially at night.
- Poor pathway and driveway lighting which is extremely dangerous.
- The villa's are unfinished but sold to the public.  It doesn't seem someone has done a completion punch-list before handing it to operations for sale.  Kitchen stove did not work, toilets had construction dirt at the bottom, exposed wiring, sliding door locks not locking, shower head blocked, driveway had potholes, kitchen insufficiently resourced.
- Frosting in the bathroom windows are only halfway and neighbouring villas can still see in.
- Construction workers perving and staring into your villa while you're laying by the 'private' pool.
- The only negative comment from a service standpoint was the Guest Relations Officer who said she was going to check on something we asked and to come back to us, but she never came back nor checked but then went to sit at her laptop on the lobby lounge chairs.  She also said that the Eggs Benedict would take an hour because the restaurant was full - there were only 5 tables occupied.... I don't see how this explanation was okay..

In summary, Selong Selo will be a very nice villa resort one day, but I think it's still another 12-18mths away as there is a lot of villas still to be constructed.  If you're happy to be on a construction site, then you will have a great time but otherwise you will be quite annoyed.  The website is beautiful but does not actually depict the true picture of the resort in its current state.  For what we paid, I'm disappointed and would have expected a completed and fully operational resort.

The staff can only do so much but unfortunately it's the hardware that is letting the software down.  The team are awesome!

For whoever is the developer, I would fast track the construction or sales of the villa's as for every day that goes on, the credibility will depreciate to a point that it will be very hard to bring the demand back up.  Alternatively, just close - go hard to completing the construction and re-open.

My rating is Average, as I don't believe it's 'Poor' which is 2 dots only because the staff were so good, but it is below average.
title: A Construction Site.... at least for another 12-18 mths

text:
My husband and I just stayed in a 2-bedroom villa at Selong Selo Resort and Residences in July 2018.  This was our first time in Lombok and we really enjoyed it.  The villa was incredibly beautiful, modern, and comfortable and included it's own plunge pool.  The view from the villa was breathtaking.  The villa comes with a butler who attended to our every need.  The restaurant at the resort is beautiful and delicious.  We ate breakfast and lunch at the restaurant on different days, and ordered food from the restaurant to the villa one of the nights.  The resort's infinity pool is right next to the restaurant and it is absolutely beautiful with amazing views.

The resort is 10 minutes away from Selong Balank Beach, which is a beautiful, quiet beach with amazing views.  We also had the resort arrange a car for us to visit Kuta beach.  Which was nice to see, but not as beautiful as Selong Balank Beach.  We also had the resort arrange a snorkeling trip to Gili Layar, Gili Nanggu, and Gili Rengit, and it was amazing.  We saw many fish, amazing coral, and sea turtles.  

We live in the United States so we are very far away.  However, we will definitely be returning to Lombok and staying at Selong Selo Resort and next time we would like to stay longer at the resort and enjoy the pool and bar at the restaurant.
title: Amazing Place To Stay In Lombok

owner_response.text:
Dear mm91422,
Thank you for taking your time and writing this warm review, which has been delivered to the Selong Selo Team. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us at wonderful Selong Selo Resort and Residences. 

As our property is very new and we are increasing our offer every day, we are excited to inform you that we are having a new promotion complemented by a stunning view from Aura restaurant- Sunday roasts, which will start from August onwards, complete with a Make Your Own Bloody Mary Bar.

 There is now an actual shuttle bus in place to transport our guests to and from the beach throughout the day, and soon, to neighboring Kuta, which also has some breathtaking sites and activities i.e. Merese Hills, sunset horseback riding, and Tanjung Aan beach.

text:
Selong Selo isn’t exactly a resort, at least yet.  It’s a villa complex, and at the time we visited in early July 2018 lots of the villas were under construction.  That little bit of context will help you understand re rest of this review.
 
The first thing to say about Selong Selo is that the views are amazing.  Built into the side of a hill looking down over Selong Belanak beach every villa has breathtaking views.  We stayed in two bespoke and one two bedroom villas and the views of all of them were outstanding.  The construction standards were also good; the fittings and fixtures were high quality and generally worked well which is no mean feat given the location.  As a place to sit on the pool deck and watch the ocean and sky it is difficult to beat.  Check out the photos for yourself.
 
The fact that the resort is new means there is nothing really around the resort itself; there’s a tiny store over the road but nowhere within walking distance to shop or eat or get massages.  There is a shuttle bus, just a car really, which will take you down to the beach itself; a drive of about 15 minutes.  There you can get cheap food and beer and there’s another resort with a reasonably priced spa.  It’s a long white sand beach and lots of people were learning to surf there.  Whilst the shuttle bus had nominal departure and return times we seemed to be the only family using it and they were pretty flexible about sending it to pick us up when we needed it.  Just bear in mind that this is a holiday for views and this one beach; everything else requires a drive of at least one hour and maybe two.  That is more a function of Lombok itself than the resort; things on the island are spread out and the roads are small and winding.
 
The construction didn’t seem to be a huge problem generally, but do be careful about which villa you are in.  The first one we stayed in was a (somewhat idiosyncratic) architectural masterpiece, but there was construction on both sides of it which made it noisy during the day.  The resort kindly moved us to a much quieter, smaller villa and subsequently to a bigger one which was also amazing in terms of design and views, so that fixed that.  Note too that the resort doesn’t have a gym as you would expect from a resort of this quality, at least yet.  You are basically renting a house rather than staying at a resort.
 
The main issue with this resort was not the construction per se but the fact that the service staff were still finding their feet.  We arrived on a Saturday.  Reading about their Sunday roast lunch we enquired at breakfast on Sunday about whether it was on and what the menu was.  It looked great and we booked for 3pm.  But when we arrived, nobody seemed to have any idea about the roast lunch being on at all.  After a bit of confusion they managed to dig out the menu, but it was obviously a surprise to the chef and he had to knock up what he could for it.  We sat waiting for about an hour for the rest of it to arrive and finally when we asked we were told that we had had it all.  Once we pointed out that that wasn’t the case they made it up with some other dishes and a couple of cocktails.  As you will see below the resort went out of its way to compensate us, but the incident was symptomatic of service levels generally at the restaurant.  Our daughter doesn’t eat dairy, but was given hollandaise sauce on her poached eggs then told there was no butter in it.  The board games for instance were unavailable and nobody seemed to know that they were in the room guides and were supposed to be.  Overall there didn’t seem to be clear procedures, or if there were the staff were not aware of them.  And the service staff generally, whilst very friendly, didn’t seem to pay attention to the guests in the restaurant, so if we needed something we needed to wave our arms about.
 
The resort has a new operations manager Sali and he went out of his way to rectify the situation both with our first villa and the lunch. They moved us (twice as it happened, the second time to a better villa than what we had paid for), and discounted the price of the roast lunch and laid on a fantastic barbeque in the villa itself, also at a discounted price.  The feedback we gave them on service generally was sincerely appreciated and acted on.
 
The sense you get is that this is a place which is getting itself organised.  If you want to chill for a few days and enjoy drinks looking out over the views by your own private pool in an amazing villa and take the odd trip to the beach then this is a great place.  When we went there, it wasn’t quite worth the kinds of prices they are asking for it, and it didn’t match the reviews, just because of the service levels and the lack of facilities.  But they are on it, and by the time you read this things may already have substantially improved.  Three and a half stars.
title: Not there yet....

owner_response.text:
Dear Anette S,  

Thank you for your very detailed review from your recent visit to Selong Selo.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed each villa in which you stayed and the attention to detail that has gone into each.

Your quote …“If you want to chill for a few days and enjoy drinks looking out over the views by your own private pool in an amazing villa and take the odd trip to the beach then this is a great place.”  … is what many of our guests prefer and enjoy doing, as well as more active holidays including surfing, paragliding, and climbing the second highest volcano in Indonesia, Mount Rinjani.

I am sorry that I did not get to meet you during your visit, as I was away from Indonesia during that time.

We take food allergies and intolerance very seriously.  My understanding is that the chef had prepared a sabayon, similar to a hollandaise, without butter. Apologies if this had not been effectively communicated to you.

Since your visit, there have been many changes, which will further improve our guest experience:

-Several new management appointments have already commenced and will continue to work closely with our naturally hospitable team in continuing to refine our guest experience.

-Our board games have arrived!  So, the next time you visit you can challenge our staff to a game of backgammon, chess, checkers, Monopoly, and more…

-Our Sunday roasts will be a promotion from August onwards.  I’m happy to hear that you had read about our Sunday roasts, and that the team mobilized to the best of their ability to meet your needs.  Our Sunday roasts will be complete with a Make Your Own Bloody Mary Bar

-There is an actual shuttle bus now- our brand new 16-seat shuttle bus has arrived with scheduled service to Selong Belanak as well as Kuta.   Kuta is less than 40 minutes away and has a wide range of International standard restaurants as well as some breathtaking sites and activities nearby, i.e. Merese Hills, sunset horseback riding, and Tanjung Aan beach.

-Our fitness equipment has arrived!  Hand-selected by a Fitness Guru and former professional athlete, our complete set of circuit-style equipment as well as conventional machines are sure to get your heart rate going.  We have set this equipment up in a temporary covered outdoor space for our guests enjoyment, while our indoor/outdoor fitness center, complete with an all-day kids club is currently being constructed.


Thank you again for your valuable feedback and comments; we very much look forward to welcoming you back to Selong Selo!

Sincerely,

Raymond

text:
3박 다녀왔어요. 발리에서 뱅기로 롬복으로 이동했고 공항 - 호텔 셔틀 무료입니다. 방 딱 받고 우리나라 연예인 아파트 소개하는 곳인줄 알았어요. 너무좋아요. 샤워하며 바다를 볼 수 있고 욕조가 있어 반신욕 하면서 바다 & 사진뷰 그대로 보고 심지어 밤에 벌레만 자신있다면 별을 보며 즐길 수 있어요. 침대도 너무 푹신하고 좋아요. 아침에 눈을 뜨면 그냥 뷰가.. 뷰가 다 해먹어요. 밥도 맛있어요. 대신 호텔근처에는 식당이나 이런곳이 없으니 호텔에서 식사 다 하시거나 밥을 챙겨가야해요. 평화롭고 너무좋았어요. 

I and my bf stayed Selong Selo Resort for 3 nights. We regret staying here only 3 nights, we had to stay here more. The 1 bed room villa provided us a wonderful view and cozy living room. We stayed here in May and sometimes there was noisy by constuction. We could see tons of stars at night even while taking a shower. I usually am disapointed by the fake pics of resorts, but Selong Selo was the only/first one meets my expectation absolutely, even better! Kind staffs made our vacation amazingly. expecially thank you so much for Satria, he speaks English very well so we could know of this area more deeply and he solved our issues while staying there. We can't wait to visit here again. If you don't want to look around and just stay with your family - especially for kids with private pool and no floors so they can run everywhere - it's absolutely right choice for your vacation. 

It would be very nice if I can find their contact number much more easier. Email contact was not enough when my flight delayed - Lyon air is not recommendable -
and the information fo the beach. Finally our butler made a schedule but we stil not sure of the shuttle bus time schedule.

text:
Truly enjoyed my stay in a private 2BR villa. The bed and furnishings were of premium quality and the best part is the infinity pool overlooking the pristine Selong Belanak Beach. The views of this resort will take your breath away and it’s a great place to disconnect from the hustle and bustle of city life.

The staff were friendly and always quick to assist with anything you need. The chef was super accommodating to my dietary needs and came to check on me after he heard that I was choking from eating a chilli! He then whipped up an off-the-menu dish to cater for my taste preference without a fuss. It was simply delicious! The bartender also offered an extra serving of their roasted coconut candy when he saw us savouring it. We even got a free Halloween brownie which was super spooky but delicious.

The resort owns surf boards and provide a shuttle service to the beach. We took surfing lessons from the recommended shop and was assigned a very patient instructor. We managed to ride some baby waves at the end of 2 hours!

The resort is quite remote and away from the main tourist areas/town so it will be hard to get supplies/snacks. But this is part of its charm as you get to enjoy the tranquility of your clifftop home away from home. :)
title: Breathtaking ocean view, modern furnishings & warm hospitality

text:
I couldn't get the concept of this villa at all. 
It was marketed and portrayed as a luxury resort/villa but it is a disappointment when it's doesn't live up to it. 

This is based on my own experience on a studio villa.

The studio villa is pretty quaint and quite spacious, BUT the design and layout of the space is not functional at all. 

There's no where to hang things unless in wardrobe, but there's alot of room to out something at the side for extra hanging pole/sockets. 

The TV is quite old model (must have been at least 15 years old), so none of our USB sticks works to view movies. 

There's no soap/shampoos shelves or holders in the toilet so you have to put it down on the floor? Or get it at outside bench where you will have to wet the floor to get it and put it back again?

The foods there is so so.. had better food served at other villas. 

There's no spa/massage available in house so I have to book at a villa nearby. The arrangements I have to make myself, the hotel doesn't even do it for me. That's a new luxury touch, I suppose.

Every single thing and request come at an extra cost ++, which is scary. So I have to think twice to ask for anything but no choice when you are stranded in the mountain high with no escape. 

There's alot of bugs - from small ants to bigger ants from inside to outside (the pool area). I guess another new luxury touch? 

Internet connection is very bad. Not connected for me most of the times, and we experience power trip on first night also - which was resolved quite promptly. 

The view is breathtaking and spectacular! Overlook the ocean view and greenery! Nothing beats that for sure. 

So I guess, based on my experience, I'm paying luxury for the views and nothing else.
title: Confusing - doesn't live up to the luxury marketing ads

My 2 kids, hubby and I had a fantastic trip to Lombok over the summer for 2 weeks staying at Selong Selo. The resort is stunning and has the most amazing view. So tranquil, so relaxing and a great place to unwind. 
Our 3 bedroom villa was very clean, modern and in pristine condition. We had a private plunge pool as well as a BBQ. We made use of their daily shuttles down to Selong Blanek beach which is by far the best beach on the island - white sand and crystal blue water. My kids learnt how to surf and we had many days lazing on the beach and watching glorious sunsets.
Aura restaurant served yummy breakfasts every morning and we had dinner a few times. Great food and amazing service.
The Selong Selo staff are very attentive and made our stay super enjoyable.
The airport is only 25 minutes away so it's easy to get to. We came from Singapore so a short weekend trip is very doable. Paradise is not too far away.
Will definately be back!

We had a fantastic stay for two weeks at Selong Selo, using as a base to explore the island.
The resort is amazing, well managed and our two-bed villa was very modern with an excellent unimpeded view, across the infinity pool, of the beautiful Selong Belanak Bay in the distance. The morning chorus in the jungle hills was beautiful and the sunsets and the lit-up fishing boats in the sea made every evening special.
The staff were truly welcoming, polite and well trained to make our stay as special as possible, many of them local and happy to chat and tell you all about their beautiful island.
Our villa had fast Wifi, all mod cons, was driver serviced, plus there is a taxi service to any part of the island. 
The Aura restaurant was well run and the food was a good fusion of Indonesian and SE Asian
The boys went to the gym which was open 24/7 and loved surfing down on the beach, an unspoilt, soft sand, huge curved bay.
Selong Selo is very special remote spot that is worth the drive to and which sets the bar for luxury in South Lombok 
We will be back for sure with our friends. Thanks you Selong Selo for the great friendly service.

text:
We were fortunate enough to stay in this resort last year (I had meant to do a review straight away as it was such a fabulous experience).  We were collected from the airport by a courteous driver and driven through the windy roads through palm trees and then suddenly, out of nowhere Selong Selo resort appears like an oasis!  We were warmly welcomed by Taner, the Manager who was extremely helpful in every respect during our stay, advising on where to eat, do yoga and surf and also giving us useful tips as we wished to buy pottery urns similar to the ones in reception..  The reception is open plan and also doubles as the spacious bar/restaurant.  Travel around the resort is by buggy if necessary but it is not difficult on foot.  There is also a twice daily shuttle down to the beach.
We were impressed by the modern architecture and design of the villa and even more blown away by the spectacular vista (worth it on its own!) 
We had a six person villa for five of us which was huge.  It had an open sitting area with satellite tv and kitchen, there was also a mini kitchen which I presume was for the caterers which contained a very handy water cooler.  The villa has a mobile phone to use to request any assistance or make food orders from the restaurant.
The outside area was stunning, amazing views from the infinity pool, we were also able to see monkeys in the trees from there.  Unfortunately when we were there there was still building work being carried out but the disruption was minimal and certainly didn't spoil our stay. There is another outside kitchen with a barbecue and large dining table and a seating area to relax in.
We took the buggy to the beach most days where I did yoga and my family learned to  surf.  There is also an excellent restaurant there where I can recommend the seafood.  Apart from that there are not any nearby restaurants.  The restaurant in the hotel was very good and the breakfast amazing - so much choice!!  Many different types of teas, coffees and juices and an abundance of choice of food.  The staff were always attentive, helpful and friendly and went out of our way to meet our every need.
We really didn't want to leave and can't wait to get back!
Many thanks to Taner and all the staff there who made our stay so wonderful.
title: Awesome and relaxing

text:
Staff were excellent but Management needs to get its act together. 

Quite a Bit of very loud construction noise (diggers and machinery rumbling from 7 am to 5 pm, plus random hammering and sawing) keeps this work in progress from being quite restful.

Maybe it wouldn’t be so bad for all those  small groups of construction workers wandering the lanes between villas, opening fences and pulling Cale but it’s all going on without so much as a “0please excuse our noise.”  This was not the retreat I expected. 

GM was blasé about our reservation mixup and although she managed to accommodate us all without incurring charges, her attitude was not sympathetic but rather overly concerned with maintaining a PR line. 

Front desk weekend days girl (‘not Angie who was done) forgot to tell me WiFi password and I had to ask her for the key. Just before checking out, we booked a hotel car transfer. she asked if our group wouldn’t mind sharing a van to the airport with some other guests. We consented, ended up waiting for 15+ minutes , with our bags packed by the lobby, for the van to swing by and collect us... finally I just asked her, where’s the van to the airport? She said “oh I’m sorry! I forgot to tell you that they already left!” Sheesh! Not easy to forgive a good like that! 

Now the villas are tastefully decorated and the beds are firm, the view stupendous, and a decent kitchen, but the lack of privacy is disconcerting. You are unlikely to feel safe from prying eyes while out in your plunge pool or relaxing on the deck. Seems there’s always an angle of looking into someone else’s villa or pool area, and it’s reciprocal as well. Several new villas are under construction now, and this is no hideaway... it’s chock a block with glass walled units! 

Shower/ bath areas of villas very nice but dare I complain about one more thing? The conditioner smelled disgusting and didn’t even de tangle or condition my hair. People in another villa said the exact same thing... weird. 

We went to use the big main pool up by the Aura restaurant and found it under filled and filthy. Dead insects and other flotsam was mixed up in it and the water filtration was clearly not working. Front desk dais ‘yes it has a leak so we can’t fill it all the way ( to the infinity edge). Well, they should actually just close it. More unfathomable PR. 

Drivers were great, picking us up in golf carts and taking us up to main lobby and restaurant as needed; kids club is good as is gym. Look, this has many aspects of a fine resort. but with management not in control, despite very low occupancy, it’s just not good value.
title: Wait til construction phase is over

owner_response.text:
Dear expaddy,
 
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We apologise for the inconveniences during your complimentary stay. We understand there was a mix up at the beginning with your arrival, which the team rectified as quickly as possible, offering an option for you to stay in the lower villa studio room or accommodate you in a private villa complete with its own pool. Some villas within the resort are currently under construction, something that we disclose openly to guests who book through normal channels. We take your feedback seriously and will ensure that efforts are made to limit the inconvenience. The repair issue in Aura's pool has been fixed and open for guest use. For your departure transfer, the team enquired if a sharing arrangement would be acceptable, and this was confirmed. However, this was not necessary and a car was arranged solely for your transfer, at a discounted rate. We appreciate your feedback and will take all the necessary steps required so that guests have a pleasurable stay at Selong Selo.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Recently left Selong Selo after a 4 night stay. We were extremely excited about staying here after viewing pictures and being marketed as a luxury resort. However, prior to even arriving at resort we were let down from the pre-arranged airport transfer we had organised that did not show up and left us having to deal with that. On arrival and mention of this, staff did not apologise and were dismissive. While the villa is very nice and amazing views, we experienced several issues with the villa immediately on arrival that you should not expect from a 5 star resort including not being well cleaned. Constant noise from construction work and blaring music all day. Thought the management staff and reception were not too helpful and dismissive of us and we believed that as a younger couple, we would not have experienced this if we were older. Food service was poor considering there was never anymore than 5 other people in the restaurant at anytime. This included the wrong meals, extraordinary wait times including a 2 hour wait for room service dinner on our last night that when delivered, the food was almost cold and the vegetarian pizza consisted of carrots, broccoli, beans and nothing else, and regardless of language spoken, this pizza sounds wrong to anyone. The resort is very isolated and the Selong Selo have very strict times for shuttle buses down to the nearest civilisation (aka a very nice beach with a wonderful beach bar and many nice and helpful people). If you want to travel at any other times than the 4 times the buses head down to the beach, you have to pay. No stores nearby to buy food or other essentials, leaving you to only depend solely on the resort, or travel 30+ minutes at your own expense to Kuta. At time of checking in a security deposit was payed and were assured it would be released when we checked out with no delay, only to find out on departure that it could take 2 weeks to get back into our account and that it was quite a significant amount and much more than any other security deposit we have had to pay on our numerous travels around the world. We will travel back to explore more of Lombok, however, we will definitely not return or waste our money at Selong Selo.
title: Doesn’t live up to luxury resort

owner_response.text:

Such things are not acceptable and senior teams have been aptly advised where paying attention to detail is vital.  With reference to your villa and cleanliness, our housekeeping team make every effort to ensure this is so; and understand if this was not addressed fully our apologies.  Additionally your food & beverage experience, our teams make efforts to ensure orders are well received, taking note of what is required, and delivering in a timely manner – if this was not so, again I will ensure this is reiterated to the team and apologise .  For beach shuttles we certainly could’ve offered more flexibility noting there were only a few guests, something we have spoken with the team about.  As an aside we are in “soft open” where rates are reflective of and on booking the resort being in the midst of construction is disclosed. Do understand however with your booking, this could’ve been missed.  We are indeed isolated, the charm for most guests is the experience of being “off grid” however this is not for everybody (and shops are a one way trip of 35 minutes otherwise local shops are nearby to cater for basic requirements). Again thank you for your comments, and where possible if there is an opportunity of redemption we do welcome the opportunity for your to visit again, and reach out directly when you do so.

text: Absolutely fabulous resort. Spectacular views and amazingly attentive staff. The food was great, lots of variety and we had some great day trips snorkelling, waterfalls and beaches. One evening we had a bbq at our villa which was a real highlight, everything was so tasty and beautifully prepared. Selong Belanak Beach was our favourite, the water was crystal clear and warm. The beach was very clean and we saw the farmers herd their bullocks up the beach each afternoon as the sunset and the call to prayer echoed through The Valley. In the evening the bay was filled with the lights from the boats of the local fisherman... picture perfect location. There are still some building works in play but it didn’t bother us too much. Lombok is very quiet compared to Bali, and is still developing as a tourist destination, so you need to be realistic on what to expect outside resort areas. The people are beautiful, very friendly, family focused and generous.

Whilst the Villa complex is very isolated, the location and vista are amazing.  Our villa had a definite "Wow" factor.  A couple of minor design problems (no powerpoint in the bathroom for a hair dryer or a standard mirror). Unfortunately one night at 11pm our smoke detector started beeping in the 2nd bedroom, and thank goodness for the 24 hr concierge it was fixed shortly after calling.  The next night the power went off in our Villa, this meant that we had no air conditioning, no water no phone service to contact the 24 hr concierge so we had to wait till early morning to report this to the office, again this was fixed immediately.  The next night the smoke detector went off in the main bedroom at 4am in the morning, again thank goodness for the 24 hr concierge.  
It was disappointing to note that we had not been advised that the complex is still very much a construction site, although we had communication with the resort prior to our arrival.  
If you are thinking of having a massage I would definitely recommend you have this in your villa, the "spa" is not worth visiting and its noisy.  The spa beds are in need of being replaced and generally this was not a pleasant experience.
Thank you to Stuart who was very accommodating and doing an excellent job.

text:
Spent a week here courtesy of a special with Luxury Escapes. What a place.
Had 5 days of pure bliss. We were in Villa 4B which was a 2x2 with an approx. 15m pool overlooking a view that just kept going.

We arrived in the mid evening and although there was a small wait for our driver, once in the car we were treated like any tourist staying at a high class resort should be.

Arriving at the Resorts' front steps after a 35 min car ride, were were meet with warm wet towels to refresh our faces and a lovely warm drink to quench our thirst. The GM introduced himself and with check in over quickly, we were driven to our villa.

The villa was beautiful but it wasn't until the light of the next day that we could really appreciate everything that we had. 

Our goal was to do nothing for 5 days but relax by the pool, read books, snooze, swim, drink beverages and that's exactly what we achieved.

The villa came with an iPhone and Whatsapp. This allowed us to communicate directly with our butler who would organise anything we required. A driver to collect us for dinner, more Bintang for the fridge, room service, spa bookings ....   

We also organised a trip to the local waterfalls. Our driver, Lalu was superb. A great guide that kept us entertained, made sure that we were looked after when we needed to go with our scooter drivers and that no-one was doing anything wrong by us. He is an asset to the whole team. In fact, there was not one person who worked there that I could say anything negative toward. 

We had previously read reviews about holidays being upset by construction and I must say that it was no concern to us at all. Our private space was not intruded on at all and the noise was kept to a minimum. In fact, the local monkey's having a family tiff caused more of a stir.

I can't recommend this place enough and only hope that when the resort is finished and at capacity, it doesn't lose the personal service that we received.

Can't wait to go back !!!!

text:
Location: The Selong Selo Resort is situated in the south of the Lombok Island around 20 minutes from Lombok International Airport. It’s around 2 hours by car from Bangsal Ferry terminal, in case you wish to use the Fast boats connecting Bali to Lombok.  Make sure you haggle with taxi drivers for your ride to the hotel, as they will always try to over charge you, just like in Bali. We had pre-booked a driver, but make sure you don’t accept their first price and always push the price down as much as you can, sometimes by a quarter of what they offered initially. 

Rooms & Facilities: The staff as in all resorts are welcoming, and settle you into your villa explaining the facilities of the villa. We had a beautiful view overlooking the entire farm land below us and a clear view of the ocean and sunset behind the hills. Our villa had a beautiful infinity pool but there was glass balustrade around our porch, which did not provide us with privacy. Same problem with open glass windows as walls from ceiling to floor on both sides of the villa. Construction workers working nearby could clearly see into our villa and we had no privacy. We try to move to other villas, but some had same issue of lack of privacy or some had no glass windows in the bathroom to protect you from insects and geckos entering the villa (which was an odd design feature of the villa).

So we decided to stay in the original villa and request management to put up white bed sheets and fabric on the glass windows and Balustrades to provide us with some level of privacy. You don’t want to be travelling half way around the world and be stock in your bedroom and not use the full facility of the villa. 
The villa had full kitchen and two bedrooms. Large sitting room area with Wi-Fi and TV. We don’t cook much but if you wished you could have easily cooked your own food with the pots and pans provided. 

Food: The resort like many in Bali offer to bring your food to your villa at no extra cost. The food was very nice, and as Lombok is a mainly Muslim inhabited island the meat was all halal. Some occasions the food delivered lacked some minor things like ketchup sauces and other bits and bobs, which would be catering staff would have to go back to restaurant and come back with your full order, but overall the food was delicious and having the food at your Villa porch gave that extra level of privacy.  
Service: The fumigation/fogging outside of the villa helps a lot. Every evening before sun down staff would come to place mosquito coils outside on the porch, which helped decrease the number of mosquitos. The villa was stayed in had seals to prevent geckos and insects from coming in, but most other villas didn’t have good sealing on the sliding doors. 

If you hate geckos and insects don’t bother coming to Bali or Lombok, you will be paranoid and won’t be able to sleep at night as they are all around you, especially geckos.
title: Selong Selo Resort has fantastic views

text:
Wir waren Anfang Juni im wunderschönen Selong Selo in Lombok.
Es ist eine ca. 35 minütliche Autofahrt vom internationalen Flughafen Lomboks entfernt und liegt in den Höhen an der Klippe des Selong Belanak Beach.

Im Selong Selo hat man absolut seine Ruhe, es ist ein immenser Villenkomplex mit momentan ca. 20 fertiggestellten Villen, die mit der Zeit aber laut Management auf ca. 80 Villen ausgebaut wird.
Die Lobby, die gleichzeitig mit dem Restaurant Aura vernetzt ist hat einen sensationellen Blick aufs Meer. Der anliegende Main-Pool ist ebenfalls superschön angelegt.

Der Check-In ging reibungslos und sehr schnell. Wir wurden dann mit einem Auto zu unserer Villa gefahren, die unsere Erwartungen mehr als erfüllt hat.
Wir hatten eine 2-Bedroom Villa, wie jede andere Villa auch mit eigenem Pool und Blick zum Meer.
Die Einrichtung war super aufeinander angepasst und mit sehr viel Charme und Liebe zum Detail.

Ein Highlight ist, dass man sein eigenes Handy bekommt für den Aufenthalt mit dem man dann mit einem Butler, der Rezeption und auch dem Restaurant kommunizieren kann. Also es wird wirklich jeder Wunsch erfüllt.
Als wir ankamen, haben wir gleich etwas vom Restaurant bestellt. Die Qualität und Geschmack der Speisen sind absolutes 5 Sterne Niveau.
Ebenso das Frühstück, welches man im Aura Restaurant aber auch in seiner Villa zu sich nehmen kann.

Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit in allen Fällen, es gibt auch einen kostenlosen Shuttle-Service vom Resort zum Belanak Strand, der sehr schön und sauber ist.

Alle Villen sind voneinander getrennt, somit bekommt man kaum etwas von seinem 'Nachbarn' zu sehen und hören. Man hat also wirklich absolut seine Ruhe, außerdem ist für jeden eine passende Villa dabei, es gibt sogar Villen mit mehr als 5 Zimmern, die sehr geeignet für Familien oder auch Urlaub mit Freunden ist.

Die Sauberkeit war im gesamten Hotel einwandfrei, es wurde sehr viel Wert darauf gelegt, dass es wirklich in der ganzen Anlage und in der Villa sauber war.

Alles in allem können wir das Selong Selo sehr empfehlen und würden sofort wiederkommen. Wer Entspannung pur mit Privatsphäre und unglaublichem Blick aufs Meer sucht ist im Selong Selo richtig!
title: Ein Traumurlaub in den Höhen von Lombok!

text:
Это просто Рай. Больше всего удивил климат острова Ломбок 😍 Он как в родном Питере, дышится легко и свежо, нет ощущения, что вы в тропиках. И это всего 300 км от Бали
Я думаю, что обязательное место для отдыха, кто прилетает на Бали. Это Райский уголок с удивительным пейзажем днем и ночью.
Мы отдыхали с девушкой на вилле 5А с бассейном, с которого открывается безумный вид на море. Сама вилла очень чистая с красивой ванной комнатой и внутренним двориком. Приятно удивила 2-х разовая уборка виллы. Утренней никого уже не удивишь, а вот подготовка виллы ко сну, это супер!
Все виллы находятся на горе, поэтому все передвижения между рестораном и виллой происходят на автомобиле, который предоставляет ресепшн. Вся связь с ними проходит через WhatsApp и это удобно.
Завтраки очень вкусные и на выбор. В самом ресторане предлагается как европейские блюда, так и местные. Здесь я влюбился в банановый фреш.
Недалеко от виллы находится очень красивый пляж с белым песком и бегающими крабиками. В отличие от Бали здесь море чистое и вы можете искупаться, не смотря на волны. Местные жители предлагают в аренду шезлонг с зонтиком.
Ну и напоследок) 
Любая карта Сбербанк или Тинькофф здесь работают без проблем, если вы предупредили банк о поездке. 
И главное, позаботьтесь о заказе такси в аэропорт на ресепшн. Сервис Grab или Blue Bird не вызываются и водитель приедет через час полтора.
Спасибо вам огромное за такой прекрасный отдых и сервис.
title: Paradise

owner_response.text:
Уважаемый Сергей, 
большое спасибо за ваш замечательный отзыв. 
Вся команда Селонг Село была рада прочитать его.
Ломбок действительно очень красивый остров. И если вы ищете тишину и спокойствие, это место для вас.
Все наши виллы имеют частный infinity бассейн. Вы можете насладиться уникальным захватывающим дух видом, наслаждаясь романтическим ужином, барбекю или массажем на собственной террасе. 
Наша команда Housekeeping очень хорошо обучена и предоставляет лучший сервис для наших гостей. Подготовка виллы ко сну является одним из них.
Мы рады слышать, что вам понравилось меню в ресторане Aura. Наш замечательный шеф-повар и его команда всегда стараются убедиться, что еда очень качественная и вкусная. Вот почему наш ресторан привлекает так много гостей. 
Пляж Selong Belanak, который находится всего в 15 минутах езды от курорта, является одним из самых красивых пляжей в Индонезии.
В ближайшее время в Селонг Село появится прямой доступ к пляжу, beach club, детский клуб, тренажерный зал и даже поле для гольфа.

Вся команда с нетерпением ждет возможности поприветствовать вас снова в Селонг Село.
